unnormalised: **Load Shedding Persists in Several Indian States**
normalised: **load shedding persists in several indian states**

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26 – Several states across India continue to grapple with persistent load shedding, impacting industries and households alike. Unscheduled power cuts, lasting up to 6 hours in some rural areas of Uttar Pradesh and Bihar, are being attributed to a combination of factors, including increased demand due to the festive season and disruptions in coal supply.
normalised: new delhi, october twenty six – several states across india continue to grapple with persistent load shedding, impacting industries and households alike. unscheduled power cuts, lasting up to six hours in some rural areas of uttar pradesh and bihar, are being attributed to a combination of factors, including increased demand due to the festive season and disruptions in coal supply.

unnormalised: The Ministry of Power has issued a statement urging state electricity boards to optimize resource allocation and improve grid management. Dr. Sharma, Director of the Central Electricity Authority, stated that the organization is working closely with NTPC to ensure a consistent coal supply to power plants.
normalised: the ministry of power has issued a statement urging state electricity boards to optimize resource allocation and improve grid management. doctor sharma, director of the central electricity authority, stated that the organization is working closely with N T P C to ensure a consistent coal supply to power plants.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, businesses in industrial hubs like Surat are reporting significant losses, with some estimating disruptions costing them Rs. 50,000 per day. Residents of apartment complexes in Bengaluru are also facing challenges, relying on backup generators, adding to their monthly expenses and environmental footprint. The area experiencing load shedding in Bangalore is approximately 5000 sq ft. Concerns are mounting regarding the impact on the upcoming Diwali celebrations, with many hoping for a swift resolution to the ongoing crisis. Residents are also seeking clarity regarding revised electricity tariffs.
normalised: meanwhile, businesses in industrial hubs like surat are reporting significant losses, with some estimating disruptions costing them rupees fifty thousand per day. residents of apartment complexes in bengaluru are also facing challenges, relying on backup generators, adding to their monthly expenses and environmental footprint. the area experiencing load shedding in bangalore is approximately five thousand square feet. concerns are mounting regarding the impact on the upcoming diwali celebrations, with many hoping for a swift resolution to the ongoing crisis. residents are also seeking clarity regarding revised electricity tariffs.
